Mina Protocol Stable Debian Repository

Official Debian repository for stable Mina packages. Contains only stable packages for devnet and mainnet networks.

Supported Distributions

  • Ubuntu Focal (20.04 LTS)
  • Ubuntu Noble (24.04 LTS) *
  • Debian Bullseye (11)
  • Debian Bookworm (12) *
* Supported starting from Mina version 3.1.0 and newer

Available Packages

Package Network Debian Name
Mina Node Mainnet mina
Mina Rosetta Node Mainnet mina-rosetta
Archive Node Universal mina-archive
Mina Node Devnet mina-devnet
Mina Rosetta Node Devnet mina-rosetta-devnet

Debian Installation Guide

To install Mina packages through the APT repository, follow these steps:

1Import Debian Key (one-time setup)

Create a directory to store APT repository keys if it doesn't exist:

sudo install -d -m 0755 /etc/apt/keyrings

Import the Mina APT repository signing key:

wget -q https://stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com/key.asc -O- | sudo tee /etc/apt/keyrings/stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com.asc > /dev/null

If you don't have wget installed, install it first:

sudo apt-get install wget

Verify the key fingerprint (should be 35BAA0B33E9EB396F59CA838C0BA5CE6DC6315A3):

gpg -n -q --import --import-options import-show /etc/apt/keyrings/stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com.asc | awk '/pub/{getline; gsub(/^ +| +$/,""); if($0 == "35BAA0B33E9EB396F59CA838C0BA5CE6DC6315A3") print "\nThe key fingerprint matches ("$0").\n"; else print "\nVerification failed for Mina stable debian repo: the fingerprint ("$0") does not match the expected one.\n"}'

2Add Mina APT Repository (one-time setup)

Add the Mina APT repository to your sources list:

echo "deb [signed-by=/etc/apt/keyrings/stable.apt.packages.minaprotocol.com.asc] https://stable.apt.packages.minaprotocol.com bullseye stable" | sudo tee -a /etc/apt/sources.list.d/mina.stable.list > /dev/null

3Prioritize Stable Repository (one-time setup)

Configure APT to prioritize packages from the Mina repository:

echo 'Package: * Pin: origin stable.packages.apt.minaprotocol.com Pin-Priority: 1000 ' | sudo tee /etc/apt/preferences.d/mina

4Install Mina

Update your package list and install the Mina package:

sudo apt-get update && sudo apt-get install mina
Note: For other packages, replace mina with the appropriate package name from the table above (e.g., mina-devnet, mina-archive, etc.).
